definitions: Get on or into (a ship, aircraft, or other vehicle).
Provide (someone) with regular meals and accommodation in return for payment.
Cover (a window or door) with wooden boards.
To approach and attack (an enemy ship) by grappling and boarding it.
examples: Passengers are requested to board the aircraft at gate 12.
She boards with a local family while attending university.
They had to board up the windows before the hurricane hit.
The pirates prepared to board the merchant ship.
